nodes.documentation:
This contract inherits from ERC721
Every User/address/entity has a library of books. Calling this contract is
equivalent to creating their own library.
nodes.name: BookLedger

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC721 token exists for book with specified ID does not exist."

arguments.value: ERC721 token exists for book with specified ID does not exist.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC721 token exists for book with specified ID does not exist."

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
Mint new book to library
May want when creating a book to make a hash of the concat of some of the
properties of the book for sharing
nodes.name: newBook

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation: Get origin date of book being placed in library.
nodes.name: originDateOfBook

nodes.documentation: Get number of books in Library
nodes.name: numberOfBookInLibrary

nodes.documentation: Get number of books a user have
nodes.name: numberOfAUserHolds

nodes.documentation: Get number of books a user have
nodes.name: doesUserHaveBook

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation: Get the availability of book from library.
nodes.name: isBookAvailable

nodes.documentation: Check that the book is committed between two entities
nodes.name: isBookCommitted

nodes.documentation: Check if the book is in transmission
nodes.name: transmissionStatus

nodes.documentation: Check total account escrow for an entity
nodes.name: accountEscrow

nodes.documentation: Check security deposit / Escrow set for transferring a book
nodes.name: bookEscrow

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
Request book from the library
msg.sender: is the entity requesting to trade or checkout a book
owner: is the current owner of the book; the library
bookID: bookID of book being requested
If all statements pass, LibraryApp will contact owner that
msg.sender is requesting a book
nodes.name: requestBook

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
Sender establishes an escrow value for receiver to deposit to the contract
as a security deposit should something happen to the book
sender: entity that currently owns book, eg. librarian
receiver: entity requesting book from sender, eg bibliophile
nodes.name: commitBook

nodes.documentation:
Sender commits an escrow value for receiver to deposit to the contract
as a security deposit should something happen to the book
sender: entity that currently owns book, eg. librarian
receiver: entity requesting book from sender, eg bibliophile
nodes.name: commitEscrow

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
Checkout book
trade a book without changing ownership
Once both have committed, the currentOwner must ship the book the the
temporary owner
	    * currentOwner: owns bookID
tempOwner: temporary owner of bookID
nodes.name: checkoutBook

nodes.documentation:
acceptBook
book has been shipped and received by new or tempOwner
nodes.name: acceptBook

nodes.documentation:
Place book back into the library. This function should commit the book. Once
the book has started the process of being sent, it is up to the library to
accept the book. The person who is currently holding the book should set the
book to being in transmission to signal that the book has been release from
their possession. At this point, the mapping for the book for the library should
be empty and the book should be mapped as being in the possesion of the person
returning the book.
nodes.name: returnBook

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
Confirm receipt of loaned book, reset book availability, and
 refund escrow.
 originalOwner: address that originally owned the book and loaned it to tempOwner
 tempOwner: the reader that took out the book from the originalOwner
nodes.name: archiveBook

nodes.documentation:
Return Escrow
After the book has been returned to the library or the trade is complete,
refund the escrow amount to the requester
nodes.name: refundEscrow

nodes.documentation:
Trade Book. Trade book will allow one user to trade books with another
user without resubmitting the book to the library. This function should
initiate the transaction.
nodes.name: tradeBook

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
If a book is lost in transmission or by a user, this function should be called
to clear out any transaction information for the given book. Once this
information is cleared, the book is then burned and removed from the
library blockchain.
nodes.name: lostBook

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))
mapping(address => mapping(uint256 => struct BookLedger.Book storage ref))

nodes.documentation:
Remove book from the library
@param bookID The unique ID of the book in the library.
nodes.name: removeBook
